industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Company: **FreightTAS LLC**


**Job Description**

IMPORT OPERATIONS SUPERVISOR AIR & OCEAN


**Office based in Long Beach, CA**

Work Hours: 08:30 am to 05:30 am through Mondays to Fridays (overtime may be required when needed)

Salary - $60k to $75k

Minimum five years of relevant air and ocean import operations and freight forwarding experience - Minimum 1-3 years of supervisory experience.


**The client** is a rapidly expanding International Freight Forwarder poised for significant growth. Joining at this juncture presents an exceptional opportunity to be part of their dynamic journey.


**Role**

Assist the Import Manager in the day-to-day operations and management of the import department.


**Essential Functions**

  • Receive, review and process documentation for an assigned base of accounts, and process documents through the system
  • Track and trace FCL, LCL, and AIR shipments via steamship lines, rails, and airlines
  • Coordinate with brokers to ensure timely ISF filings and import customs clearance
  • Provide proactive information to the customer regarding arrival, delivery and shipment status
  • Ability to handle a shipment from receipt of pre-alert to delivery
  • Ability to handle 50-75 files per month including higher complexity shipments and customers
  • Coordinate with COD customers to ensure payment is received prior to delivery
  • Coordinate with truckers to ensure timely deliveries
  • Negotiate with vendors on rates when necessary
  • Generate and compile various spreadsheets or reports
  • Anticipate problems and work on solutions when they happen
  • Solve complex problems with tact and calmness
  • Billing and invoicing to ensure maximum profits are obtained on a shipment by shipment basis
  • Assist and support the Import Manager in supervising the import department
  • Other tasks as may be necessary to ensure a smooth and prompt shipping and customer service experience


**Qualifications**

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Excellent written and verbal skills
  • Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office
  • Detail oriented, able to multitask and meet deadlines
  • Self-motivated, able to work in a team and independently
  • Strong knowledge of regulatory compliance with import operations procedures, rules and regulations
  • Able to interact positively and effectively with co-workers, subordinates and supervisors


**Experience**

    • Cargowise Experience a plus
    • Ability to read, speak and write Spanish a plus
    • Authorized to work in the US for any employers Sorry, visa / sponsorship not available.
